reasoning: Opportunistic infection primarily in immunocompromised patients (HIV, transplant, chemotherapy). Global incidence ~2-3 per 100k (2005), but highly concentrated in HIV-positive populations and regions with limited HAART access. Significant underreporting in developing countries.
source: Morris A et al. (2004). Current epidemiology of Pneumocystis pneumonia. Emerg Infect Dis. 10(10):1713-20
